name: sporobolus compositus
description: Rough Dropseed is typically found in dry prairie ecosystems.  Two species of grasshopper are known to feed on Rough Dropseed; Two-Striped Slantfaced Grasshopper and Slantfaced Pasture Grasshopper.  The seeds, which form late in the summer are also enjoyed by many birds.  Rough Dropseed is a warm season grass; it actively grows during the summer when soil temperatures are warm.
features: Deer Resistant (Our experiences here in the Upper Midwest may vary in other regions; deer can respond differently to local conditions or seasonal variations.)
